meta.title: Sample STEM Quiz
meta.description: Demonstrates every supported question type including math rendering.

contexts.title: Mars outpost briefing
contexts.body: A research crew is preparing a pressurized habitat on Mars. Solar arrays provide 15 kW at peak output and charge a 50 kWh battery bank overnight. Deliveries arrive in this order: cargo lander, power module, crew vehicle. Use this shared context for the next two questions.

feedback.correct: Great! The power rule applies here.
feedback.incorrect: Remember the power rule: multiply by the exponent and subtract one.
Only numbers divisible by 1 and themselves are prime.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: The chemical symbol for water is _____.
How many degrees are there in $\pi$ radians?

Order the steps mission control follows to bring the habitat online after the cargo lander arrives. The options below are shuffled by default; set the optional `shuffleItems` flag to false if you want to keep the authored order instead.
items: Deploy and orient the solar array
correctOrder: Deploy and orient the solar array

questions.text: Using the Mars outpost briefing, explain why conservation of energy is useful when planning the power budget for night-time operations.

rubrics.title: States the principle
rubrics.description: Mentions that the total energy of an isolated system remains constant or that energy cannot be created or destroyed.

rubrics.title: Connects to problem solving
rubrics.description: Explains how the principle simplifies calculations or reduces the number of unknowns in the described scenario.

rubrics.title: Clarity
rubrics.description: Provides a coherent explanation that is understandable to another student.

feedback.incorrect: A human or LLM grader should review this response using the provided rubrics.
